rename.from: mutil-scale training does not work properly

body: Thank you. I modified '--num-workers'  and the problem was solved.
i use num_workers=0、batch_size=8, but it doesn't work,  CUDA out of memory

> @lzl4525 reduce batch size.

think you ,but My GPU has 8 G of memory,  batch_size=8 only use 3.5G .    
My dataset has only three categories，It has to do with my dataset

@lzl4525, @pwr617 this issue has been resolved.  `--multi-scale` can now be used with any number of workers, and has now been modified to behave more similarly to darknet, varying image sizes from 67% to 150% of the original `img_size`. I am closing this issue now.

Hi @glenn-jocher, would you tell me how you fix this bug? I check your code. In `train.py`, I cannot find any modification about the `num_workers`. I also check `util/dataset.py:LoadImagesAndLabels`, have got no clues. My pytorch version is 1.1.0, thank you!
@HoracceFeng issue is resolved since 12 June. Image resizing has been taken out of the dataloader to provide the fix. `Git clone` a new repo or `git pull` to get the latest.

So it actually due to the ‘resize’, right? Thx

Sent from my iPhone

@HoracceFeng to be clear: **there is no current issue. multi-scale works correctly regardless of num-workers.**

This issue is closed for a reason.
